author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao ( blue shirt ) along with NLEP members taking out a rally in Madurai on Saturday.Photo: S. James

Flagging off a two-wheeler awareness rally on the National Leprosy Eradication Day on Saturday, Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao highlighted the importance of getting medical attention during the preliminary stage itself.

Citing data, Mr. Rao said that the number of leprosy patients for every 10,000 population in the country had drastically come down from 118 in 1983 to 1 presently because of the sustained effort by the government.

He urged the officials and the public to work together to identify people with leprosy symptoms in the initial stage itself and make Madurai a leprosy-free district soon.

Mr. Rao also participated in the rally from Ganshi Museum till Palanganatham. The rally will cover five districts from Madurai to Kanyakumari over the next few days.

Dean of GRH M.R. Vairamuthu Raju, Deputy Director (Leprosy) S. Raja Mohan and Deputy Director (Health Services) S. Senthilkumar were also present during the inauguration of the rally.
title: Leprosy eradication awareness rally held
